{{Spoiler}} [[File:XC3 Armbenders.png|thumb|The Armbenders]] '''Droids''' are a family of enemies in {{XC3}}. They are only found in [[Origin]]. {{clr}}

{{for|other uses|Duel Igna}} {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Duel Igna |image = |caption = Duel Igna |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Igna]] |level = 42
95 |area = [[Syra Hovering Reefs]]
[[Erythia Sea]] ([[Rebellion Cave]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = }} '''Duel Ignas''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3}}. They are members of the [[Igna]] family, and can be found at level 42 on the [[Syra Hovering Reefs]] in the [[Keves Castle Region]], or at level 95 in [[Rebellion Cave]] of [[Erythia Sea]]. {{clr}} == In {{XC3FR|sub}} == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Duel Igna |image = Duel Igna FR.jpg |caption = Duel Igna |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Igna]] |level = 44 |area = [[Black Mountains]] ([[Raxeal Lavaflow]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = }} '''Duel Ignas''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3FR}}. They are members of the [[Igna]] family, and can be found at level 44 at [[Raxeal Lavaflow]] on the [[Black Mountains]]. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{Fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Minor Enemies]] [[Category:Keves Castle Region Enemies]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:Black Mountains Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Ignas]] [[Category:XC3FR Ignas]] [[Category:XC3 Level 41-45 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 91-95 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Level 41-45 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing drops]]

revision.comment: Created page with "{{Spoiler}} {{Infobox XC3 Status |title = Eclipse Soul |caption = Makes allies attack one another. |image = File:XC3 Eclipse Soul.png |type = Debuff | attribute = Ether | base-duration = <abbr title="The debuff does not have a defined duration, but lasts until the Art ends or soon after affected character is attacked">Indefinite</abbr> | rng-applicable = No | effect-title-4 = Remarks | effect-value-4 = This debuff cannot be removed by Arts or effects that clear debuffs...."
revision.text:
{{Spoiler}} {{Infobox XC3 Status |title = Eclipse Soul |caption = Makes allies attack one another. |image = File:XC3 Eclipse Soul.png |type = Debuff | attribute = Ether | base-duration = <abbr title="The debuff does not have a defined duration, but lasts until the Art ends or soon after affected character is attacked">Indefinite</abbr> | rng-applicable = No | effect-title-4 = Remarks | effect-value-4 = This debuff cannot be removed by Arts or effects that clear debuffs. }} '''Eclipse Soul''' is a [[Status Effect]] in {{XC3}}. It causes the affected character to attack their own allies, and prevents the player from controlling them. The debuff can only be inflicted by [[Moebius M]] when she uses the Art of the same name, during the encounter at the end of Chapter 5. If a character in an [[Ouroboros]] form is targeted, both members of the Interlink will be affected.
Characters affected by the debuff are temporarily considered to be out of the player's party, resulting in the loss of the battle if they are the only characters left alive.
During Moebius M's first phase, the affected character(s) cannot be targeted, and the debuff will not appear in the battle interface. In the second phase, the debuff will be visible, and the affected character can be targeted to damage M and prematurely end the Art. [[Category:XC3 Status]]

[[File:Ciconia ekidno.jpg|thumb|A Ciconia Ekidno]] '''Ekidnos''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|エキドナ}}, ''Ekidona'', lit. ''Echidna'') are a family of flying enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}.
== {{XC|-}} == In {{XC}}, Ekidnos are found exclusively at [[Eryth Sea]] on [[Bionis]], and are sometimes used as beasts of burden by [[Hode]]s. There are several types of Ekidno.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Ciconia Ekidno]] * [[Pelargos Ekidno]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Confusion Ekidno]] (during ''[[Hode Attack]]'') * [[Decay Ekidno]] (during ''[[Trouble at the Lighthouse]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Cumulus Danaemos]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Ciconia Ekidno]] ([[Fogbeast]])
== {{XC2|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Skode Ekidno]]
=== Quest Exclusive Boss === * [[Celestial Bailey]] (DLC, during ''[[Merclibay's Mightiest]]'')
== {{TTGC|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Oone Ekidno]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Tenax Ekidno]] (during ''[[Azurda SOS]]'')
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Gladiis Ekidno]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Blazing Karlos]]
=== Quest Exclusive Boss === * [[Memorial Ekidno]] (During ''[[My Memories]]'')
== Gallery == === {{XC|-}} === <gallery> Ciconia Ekidno.jpg Perlargos Ekidno.jpg </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> OoneEkidno.jpg TenaxEkidno.jpg </gallery>
